orangelight.title: Updating orangelight to allow undergraduates access to pickup books

comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/42315193/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/42315193)

Coverage remained the same at 97.06% when pulling **575396123d26a2ca19030231feec8adc3556bc37 on requests-allow-undergraduate** into **22c2ddc33d51dbb8aa1ec16392feefbaa95f6d98 on main**.

@carolyncole I compared the two examples you provided in slack. The one in catalog-qa after deploying this PR. https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/99124624583506421?mfhd=22707996030006421&source=pulsearch

![Screen Shot 2021-08-20 at 4 58 56 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/130292733-3e9546c9-20d0-4051-8a07-cce0324de7c2.png)

vs the one in production https://catalog.princeton.edu/requests/99124624583506421?mfhd=22707996030006421&source=pulsearch

![Screen Shot 2021-08-20 at 4 59 26 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/130292791-2cdf50ab-3dc9-4a79-ad26-9c6727eba58d.png)

You mentioned in slack that the one in production should only allow EDD.
They both seem to allow physical item pickup. I dont see a difference.

@christinach The difference should only have been for undergraduate students.  Were you checking as an undergraduate?  I'm unsure how to become a student.  If you have a trick I would love to know it.

Although I am realizing that I did not quite create this branch correctly, so maybe the restrictions for undergraduates were removed earlier and this is just clean up.  It is hard to test because anyone authorized to be on campus has always had pickup rights.  This change should only impact undergraduates that were never authorized to be on campus.
@carolyncole I don't have a way to test as an undergraduate student. I tested as me :). Ignore my screenshots.
